description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine is powered ON from a suspended
or a powered off state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vmPoweredOn VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName s EXAMPLE

description: This is the ID of the affected vm generating the trap. If the vmID
is non-existent, (such as for a power-off trap) -1 is returned.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the config file of the affected vm generating the trap.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: Name by which this vm is displayed. It is not guaranteed to be unique.
MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eguest
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine is powered OFF.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vmPoweredOff VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName s EXAMPLE

description: This is the ID of the affected vm generating the trap. If the vmID
is non-existent, (such as for a power-off trap) -1 is returned.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the config file of the affected vm generating the trap.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: Name by which this vm is displayed. It is not guaranteed to be unique.
MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eguest
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine detects a loss in guest heartbeat.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vmHBLost VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName s EXAMPLE

description: This is the ID of the affected vm generating the trap. If the vmID
is non-existent, (such as for a power-off trap) -1 is returned.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the config file of the affected vm generating the trap.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: Name by which this vm is displayed. It is not guaranteed to be unique.
MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eguest
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine detects or regains the guest heartbeat.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vmHBDetected VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName s EXAMPLE

description: This is the ID of the affected vm generating the trap. If the vmID
is non-existent, (such as for a power-off trap) -1 is returned.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the config file of the affected vm generating the trap.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: Name by which this vm is displayed. It is not guaranteed to be unique.
MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eguest
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine is suspended.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vmSuspended VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName s EXAMPLE

description: This is the ID of the affected vm generating the trap. If the vmID
is non-existent, (such as for a power-off trap) -1 is returned.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the config file of the affected vm generating the trap.

description: Name by which this vm is displayed. It is not guaranteed to be unique.
MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eguest
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmDisplayName

description: This trap is sent when entity status changed.

event.Summary: Entity status for VM $v3 on host $v2 is now $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdTrap VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdTrapType s EXAMPLE VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdHostName s EXAMPLE VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdVMName s EXAMPLE VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdNewStatus s EXAMPLE VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdOldStatus s EXAMPLE VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdObjValue s EXAMPLE

description: This is the trap type in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdTrapType

description: This is the name of the host in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdHostName

description: This is the name of the VM in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdVMName

description: This is the new status in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdNewStatus

description: This is the old status in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdOldStatus

description: This is the current object value in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-TRAPS-MIB::vpxdObjValue
